intro: Tarenna disperma, commonly known as the Madagascar star anise, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant produces small, dark purple berries that are used in traditional medicine. Tarenna disperma is typically found in moist, shaded forest environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and pharmacological studies.
